intro: Dicerandra immaculata f. nivea, commonly known as the white-flowered false dune morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its tubular flowers and climbing habit. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes and disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
